text: On tap at the brewpub, Andy Ricky PJ Andrew R. Dark pour and little/no head. Overall impression is that its a good scotch ale, but lacking a bit of the sticky tar-molasses-sugary quality that makes the style a treat to me. On the right track just a tad underdone and mellow. Still enjoyed much.

[6700-20140823] Tap. Toasted fig fruit and mild woody plastic aroma. Hazy, dark roan red brown body with a quick foamy tan head. Earthy mineral toasted grains flavour has a boozy fruity cherry overtone. Medium-full body. Good but my expectations were high. (7/3/7/3/16) 3.6
(Tap Takeover Event @ Volo, Toronto, ON)

[Draught at the brewpub, Sep.21] Pours a cloudy deep amber with no head. Aroma is smoky and malty along with dark fruit, some maple syrup and toffee. Nice flavour, malty, fruity and a bit smoky along with some hops in the finish. Medium bodied, almost oily mouthfeel. Love it!
sample at Festbiere in Quebec City, solid scotch ale. rich maltiness, earthy peat, wisp of smoke, caramel/toffee richness. very well made scotch
Smooth rich scotch on tap at bar volo. Reddish orange with some peat character. Smooth.

Pours a ripe copper color with gaseous eggshell foam. Lots of sweet maple, toffee flavors upfront that gain complexities of salted caramel, toasted malt, vanilla and a kiss of smoke. A touch flat making the body a little more sticky than Id like but still a delicious beer !

On tap at Dieu du Ciel. Very smooth. Pours a dark solid brown. Little on the nose. Nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ DDC (Montréal). Reddish amber with no head and no lacing. Aroma is of butterscotch with light moked notes and light fruits. Taste is slightly sweet and about the same as aroma. Medium body. Low carbonation. Good Scotch Ale, but the lack of carbonation didnt help and it as somewhat bland and boring.

Draft at Blind Tiger with Streets and the RB crew. Pours a deep hazy amber body with light lacing. Aroma is sweet caramel, spice and sweet booze. Mouthfeel is medium to syrupy with sweet notes of caramel, touches of vanilla and alcohol.

DDC you are the best!  On tap at Prohibition Pig is yet another amazing beer from the spawn of Nickleback.  Moderately sweet up front with a dry malty finish.  Light hops add a touch of balance to go with the cherry, nutty, toasted maltiness of the beer.
Awesome scotch ale, on draft at the prohibition pig. Great malty creamy body without being overly sweet
Beaucoup de sucre de toutes sortes, sucre candi, caramel presque brûlé et une base maltée exquise. Le liquide est rond et collant. Magnifique offrande.

On tap at the Dieu du Ciel 14th anniversary party, pours a deep, dark amber brown with a small beige head. Aroma of scotch malt, sweet candied sugar and maple syrup. Flavour of semi-sweet maple syrup, corn syrup, some scotch malt and some candied sugar. ABV is quite well-concealed, though the alcohol certainly shows. Very good.

On tap at Dieu du Ciel prior to our trip to the ice cider Mondial.  Pours a hazed ruby amber with a thin white to beige head.  Sweet caramel on the nose.  Gentle caramel, medium bodied.  Sweet notes, toast.  Sweet and malty, chewy and sweet.  Nice.
#1109 draught; nose is cork, cedarwood, dry, dark malt, sweet licorice, feel is watery, carb is mediumlow, taste is fig, rotten fruit, alcohol, later wood and earth

on tap at brewpub. murky dark brown, red tint, with a decent beige head, some retention/lacing. nose is loads of caramel, butterscotch and light fruits. taste is about the same, light but fairly present grassy hops. cloying. full body, soft to average carbonation. not my type of scotch ale, but very good.

Verre de dégustation lors du 13ème anniversaire du DDC. Le dernier dune belle séquence. Cette bière est brune, elle na pas de mousse. Je mets en doute le verre. Au nez on y découvre des arômes de toffee, de caramel, du sucre dorge et un peu de menthol léger. La bouche est très sucré, il y a beaucoup de toffee et un drôle de goût de poisson. Je ny comprend rien.  Une note provisoire de 6/10

Not usually one for Scotch ales, but this was great. pours a dark brownish color with a touch of red, nice foam, lasts well. nose is sweet almost maple syrup and molasses along with some dark malts flavors mimic the nose perfectly... really well done

500ml draught 
8.0% ABV 
I tried this beer on tap on  February 9, 2011 at "The Beerbistro" in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a dark reddish-black with a 1" foamy tan coloured head.  The aroma was roasted malt, caramel, and weak fruit.  The mouthfeel was medium bodied with medium carbonation.  The flavour was roasted malt, caramel, and molasses with a bitter finish.  An excellent tasting beer.
On tap at the brewpub with Brendan and Sacks.  Pours dark and dusty  brown with beige head.  Molasses, maple, and brown sugar,  malty,  l33tastic!

Dégustée en fût sur place à létablissement de Montréal. De couleur rouge-brune et semi-voilée. Nez malté de caramel sucré et très légèrement rôti, léger de fruits (raisins aux notes vineuses, notes de cerises) et de toffe avec des notes dalcool doux et de chocolat noir. Ronde en bouche avec un pétillement bas-moyen et une texture liquoreuse. Moyen goût fruité sucré (raisins aux petites notes vineuses, léger de cerises) accompagné de traces boisées lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un goût malté de caramel sucré aux notes rôties, des notes de chocolat noir, de biscuits à la mélasse et des traces de sucre brun puis en finale lon retrouve une moyenne-légère amertume de houblon herbeux ainsi quun léger goût dalcool liquoreux. Post-goût long, moyennement amer dalcool doux, léger de rôti et de fruits (moût de raisins) avec des notes de chocolat. (hiver 2006-07)

2002 vintage sampled at the 10th anniversary party. Pours a very haze deep amber with a thin lasting head.  Aroma is maple syrup, big oxidized sweetness, big fruits, plum, figs, sherry, flowery with earth and light spice and big caramel oxidized malts.  Flavor is earthy spicy leather, tobacco, sharp big caramel malts, oxidation, sherry, oak, dust, burnt toffee sweetness with honey, floral, sweet big malts in the finish.  Good.

On tap aged 3 years at DDC anniversary party. Murky brown, no real head to speak of. Aroma is quite a surprise: lots of sweet sticky hay and farm notes  accompanied by very discreet toffee and caramel smells. This beer smells like it was brewed in a stable, not off-putting at first, just curious. Taste is where things go down. Thick syrupy caramel toffee flavors with something like rotten vegetables, probably the hops that have gone south. Palate is ok for the style, lots of alcohol warmth with very little to back it up. I didnt finish my 6 oz glass. I was truly dissapointed as I was expecting a lot from this beer. I will give it another chance fresh if the occasion presents itself.

Glass, draught, at Dieu du Ciel!, savoured on December 4 2009; eye: ruby, clear, no effervescence, tiny beige head, light lacing; nose: malt, scotch, light hops, alcohol, pepper, light fruity (plum); mouth: malt, scotch, light hops, alcohol, pepper, plum, finale in malt with presence of alcohol warmth, medium-full body, average carbonation, lightly bitter; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS 

Verre, en fût, chez Dieu du Ciel!, savouré le 4 décembre 2009; oeil : rubis, claire, pas deffervescence, petite mousse beige, légère dentelle; nez : malt, scotch, léger houblon, alcool, poivre, léger fruité (prunes); bouche : malt, scotch, léger houblon, alcool, poivre, prunes, finale en malt avec chaleur dalcool, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation moyenne, légèrement amère; en résumé : bien bon

On tap at brewpub, a few days after their 11th anniversary.  2 years old batch.  Overwhelmingly velvety mouthfeel, delicately caramelized, some fruityness and a discreet hopping.  Probably beats any of our awesome Quebecs Scotch Ales.

Dégusté à la brasserie en format de 660ml vieilli 16 mois en date doctobre 2007 avec un % dalcool de 8%. Apparence brune ambré au reflet rubis caramellisé. Arômes de jus de canneberge, caramel légèrement poivré et pomme grenade. Un goût de cassis, dérable et de canneberge. Une bonne carbonation et de lalcool bien présente.
Un bijoux comme création, un artiste est née!

Clear dark ruby / brown poor, frothy beige head.  Aromas of bubble gum, caramel. grapes, toffee, maple syrup.  Full Flavored and bodied.  Creamy, velvetty, mouthfeel, with a good balance.  Flavors are mostly same as the aromas and alcohol.

Dégusté avec french tickler @ DCC. Une biere de couleur rouge ruby avec un moyen collet beige brumeux collant. Odeur de café, un peu cendré, sucre brun et cerises. Gout de chocolat, noix, amandes, café. Excellent!!

En fût au 10eme.Version 2001. La bière est de couleur orange brûlé trouble avec une mousse fauve imposante qui reste. Au nez on respire des arômes de vieux caramel, de malt fumé, de chocolat, de wedder original, de pommes rouges avec des esters dalcool. En bouche le corps est très rond et très moelleux avec une effervescence faible. Au départ le caramel sexprime, ensuite on goûte le boisé et la finale senvolle avec des esters dalcool et de fumé. En rétro on goûte le chocolat. Très complexe.
DDC 10th.  Draft.  Dark amber body, light caramel, dark fruit, etoh and candy sweetness.  Good beer.

Draft, 2005 vintage @ DDC 10th Anniversary Party.  Pours a hazy amber-golden color; light tan head with good retention and fine-bubbled lacing.  Solid amounts of dried fruits, caramel, and brown sugar in the aroma.  Medium-to-full mouthfeel: chewy dried fruits, caramel, and sweet malts upfront; definitely on the chewy side; relaxed carbonation; some oxidation, dried fruits, and chewy maltiness; solid, generous scotch ale.  Lengthy finish: dried fruits, caramel, and sweet maltiness.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2008 Appears a dark amber with touches of gold and orange.  Sweet aroma with caramel and nuts.  Palate is supremely smooth, and deliciously medium-thick!  Features a rich sweet flavor of toffee, caramel malt and nuts, as well as a touch of smokiness.  Cornemuse is wonderfully balanced with soft esters and some earthy notes. Through the mid-palate and finish, the flavors linger in your mouth, which, considering the quality of this brew, is a truly special thing.

Five Years Old!

  Aroma of butterscotch, caramel, treacle and some fabulous malt. Garnet, with a small toffee head. Superb candied malt start, and all the goodies mentioned above, some pit fruit, alcohol is noted and  appreciated. Full bodied, very well balanced, rich texture, almost like candied ribbon, warming, lovely mouthfeel. Wonderful!

12 ounce tulip glass on tap at the brewpub.  Sweet, malty, vinous, fruity aroma.  There is a touch of smokiness with some peatiness, too.  Very nice, aromatic, scotch ale.  Modestly transparent dark amber/cola-colored body with a tan-orangeish head that is small.  A bit smoky, leathery. peaty, maltiness to start.  Very full-bodied and a bit sweet in the middle.  Lightly spicy, mildly bitter hops to finish.  Decadent, full-bodied, flavorful, and very drinkable.  Quality beer.

9mo aged cask at the brewpub, DDC 9th anniversary - 5 years old.
Aroma: Clean with a low smokiness, port, madeira and light licorice.
Appearance: Dark brown with a low head.
Flavour: Clean maltiness with a rich melanaoidin malt character. Full and rich with no hops no bitterness and still very clean for its age reaping the best of the aging affects.
Mouthfeel: Medium bodied, creamy.
Overall: Wow who would have thought a scotch ale could age so well. Much better and more complex with a great woodiness and lots of port and madeira character. Finishes dry rather than sticky and sweet. For my money, my favourite of the beers on tap that night.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2014 2014-08-23. Very dark brown body with a small tan head. 3++ Aroma of earthy malt, toasty not quite peaty notes. Sweet fruity malt core. Flavour has rich fruity malt base, odd toasty earthy malt accents. Lingering earthy not quite smokey quality. Smooth medium bodied palate, soft carbonation. 3+ Nice beer but I remember it being more sweet malt and less earthy character. 7/4/7/3/14-15 - 3.6 On tap at DDC Tap Takeover Event, Volo, Toronto
2006-12-XX. Apparently saved the best for last this evening. Dark brown with a smallish creamy tan head (3+) that I suspect is partly due to the very full pour that I received - Im not complaining! Sweet caramel aroma, dark fruit and sugar notes. Dark sweet malt flavour, moderate caramelized dark fruit. Smooth medium mouth feel. Is not superbly complex, but this is just delicious! 8/4/9/4/18 - 4.3 At the brewpub
Bu sur place en fut (12 oz). Rousse brune foncée, petit collet. Légé arome de scotch et de malte caramelisé. Bon goût de scotch, un peu sucré mais rien dimpresionnant.

Hazy dark mahogany hue, with some reddish highlights, a tan-colored head, with a sweet malty nose of toasted and caramelized malts, with some dark fruits fruitiness notes, a faint wineyness accent, a dark chocolatey tones, and a sweet cherry liquorish aroma follows through on a full-bodied palate with a sweet toasty, caramelized malt character, with some bitter chocolatey winey notes, hint of dark coffee roastiness, candied dark fruit accents of raisins,plums,dates and fruitcake, with a liquorish mouthfeeling, a touch of brandy, with an alcoholic warmth feeling, leading towards a sweet grainy malty, and subtle hops bitterness on the finish.

Can you say solid lineup??? This beer pours a deep amber with a whipped-cream off-white head. The aroma is heavily malty, dark fruits, wheat toast, fresh out-of-the-oven cookies. The body is heavy w/out being cloying. The flavors are light chocolate, creamy caramel, a hint of alcohol,  and just a touch of diacetyl (totally appropriate). The finish is decidedly sweet and delicious. Great beer.

draught. deep brown-ruby coloured body with a medium off-white head. aroma, as it warms up, smells of burnt caramel, chocolate, sugar, and woody earth notes. sweet malt full body with plenty of raisin and dark fruit flavours. caramel and subdued dark chocolate is in there too. good balance with a slight punch of alcohol in the middle and through to the yeasty finish. nice.

En fût. Robe brune très claire aux reflets rouges surmontée dune mousse blanche timide. Arômes de malt, de cassonade et de raisins. Saveurs de malt, de miel, de mélasse et de raisins. Houblon de soutien.

Bouteille de 660 ml vieillie 1 an dégustée lors du 7e anniversaire du Dieu du Ciel. Arôme: Odeur de caramel sucrée et de fleurs. Apparence: Couleur ambrée. Mince col beige mousseux. Aucune bulles et aucune dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel et et dalcool. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est plein avec une texture liquoreuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût dalcool. (Rating #279)

Sampled a bottle aged ~1 year (oct2004) at the 7th anniversary party.
Reddish amber, with a clingy, mother of pearl head.
Quite interesting balance of sweetness and booze at first in the nose, as my glass warmed it had an olive oil fragrance, and then morphed again to a oily, sticky hoppiness.
Caramel, malty sweet body, a tad peaty with a warming finish, like mixing a little turbinado sugar with rhum.  

I only get sporadic cravings for this type of Beer, and even though I wasnt necessarily in the mood for it, this aged Cornemuse was worth trying out.
UPDATED: MAY 15, 2005 Brown , black tea like , small head . Medium bodied , full flavoured . Nice bitter accents with alcohol mix . Rich and gentle . Very nice ale .

On draught at the brewpub with MartinT, beerbuzzmontreal and his friend, 4/16/05.  This was put on tap right before we were going to leave, making yours truly very happy.  Pours a deep burgundy-amber color, with light tinges of auburn, somewhat clear and with a medium-sized beige head, some retention.  Aroma of sweet toffee, sweet oranges and a touch of dry hops.  Flavor outdoes the aroma, IMHO, giving forth plentiful caramel, butterscotch, light earthiness, a bit of musty/dusty yeast and some plums/cherries.  Finishes, unfortunately, a bit too thin, with a little bit of papery astringency or perhaps spiciness.  Complex notes in the background are very subtle and only tease the palate: vanilla, oak, peat, leather, raspberries.  Very low carbonation, smooth, even mouthfeel, if somewhat watery on the end.  Medium body.

Snifter at the brewpub, accompanied by the exuberance of tiggmtl.  Very dark, clear ruby-red body with little head...dark cherries, a touch of strawberry, fresh earthiness and caramel in the powerful aroma...cherries, maple and late complex dry spiciness (tarragon and oregano) smoothed out by a touch of vanilla-oak..awe-inspiring.

nez:miel,caramel
Tres belle couleurs brune avec un tres beau collet de mousse.
Gout:Caramel,miel,melasse doux pour une scotch ale.

On tap. Ruby/brown hue, nice creamy off-white head leaves a trace on the glass with every new sip. Big malty aroma, typical from DDC. Very floral, smoky. Notes of ashes, meat, stonewood. Palate has plenty of bitterness to support the sweetness though it remains in a smoky fashion, never agressing. Fruity (orange) with undertones of barley sugar, maple, fresh bread grains. Generous grassy and almost spalt like hop profile. Creamy mouthfeel with small bubbles biting your tongues curiosity. Great.

Sampled cask conditioned at the brewpub.
Nut brown. Red berries and toffee up front. Sweet and honeyish, richly malty with clean mouthfeel and resiny, very bitter finish.
Draft at the brewpub.  A knockout:  dark ale, thin head, great lasting lacing.  Sweet, malty arorma; rich balanced flavors, easy on the hops and not sugary.  Awesome.

Dark amber body topped with an average off-white foamy head. Very pleasant malty aroma with caramel, toffee, and brown sugar hints. Alcohol remains well hidden. Taste is very well balanced. Starts with a sweet feeling and soft carbonation. Then comes solid hoppy flavors. Finish is long and relatively bitter. Very nice Scotch Ale.

Age for one year and nine months, bottle.Brown color with ruby hues, thin offwhite head. Aroma of caramel and raisin. Flavor of caramel, raisin and alcohol. Medium body, soft carbonation, liquorous mouthfeel.

Deep copper body and mild carbonation. Nice Scottish malt aroma. Great flavor. Fairly sweet, malty, toffee and candy sugar flavor. Just plain delicious. Very smooth palate. The flavor grabs you and immediately pleases the taste buds but never really reveals a great deal of depth. Still, this is candy for grownups.
Red brown in colour with a sweet porto aroma. Sweet motuhfeel with some soft hops, maple, porto, stewed raisin. Wonderful mouthfeel.

Mild sweet toffee aroma. Clear dark reddish brown. Pours to a nice frothy tan head with large bubbles - recedes somewhat quickly with some lacing. Malty-sweet flavour with some bitterness. Residual lasting maltiness. Good creamy thick body. Cornemuse #4 Oct. 2000 (3yr) 7.5% bottle conditioned.
(Draught) Mahogany with almond head. Scent of barleywine - scotch and vanilla. Creamy finish. Love this place!
Copper colour.  Aroma of candy and caramel.  Flavour of malts, caramel, toffee, smooth and creamy.
(1 year old aged version)  Dark mahogany, small fine bubbled beige head.  Toffee with cherry notes aroma.  Slightly burnt volutptuous caramel.  A Dieu du Ciel classic!
UPDATED: JAN 10, 2004 Licorice and candy sugar in complacent caramel...Abundant berries (cherries?) in gorgeously ample palate...Drier hop presence in the aged version...
Full malty character.  Thick body, with toffee and smoke.
